metadata.bijbeltekst: Parable of the Tenants (implied Mark 12:1-12 / Matthew 21:33-46)

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher addresses the murder of Mrs. Alberta King, analyzing the social and spiritual causes of violence before moving to the Parable of the Tenants to illustrate God's ultimate victory.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Narrative and evocative. Rather than technical exegesis, the preacher 're-tells' the parable to map it onto the current tragedy.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of evil and the history of the church, shifting toward a communal testimony of resilience.
voorbeelden: A part of the answer is in the greed of our country.
God must be asked to forgive us this morning.
They won't be able to kill us off.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the congregation from shock and despair to a sense of defiant hope and communal identity.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the Spirit is the implied source of the choir's strength and the 'others' God raises up.

voorbeelden: The car had been sent to the Atlanta airport.
There is a poisoned atmosphere in our black communities.
I do not know the servant's name.
He will pull down those evil men.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are framed as future-tense certainties about God's sovereignty rather than direct address to the hearer.

voorbeelden: God must be asked to forgive us this morning.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher acts as a witness/reporter of God's authority rather than an agent of it.

indicatoren: Extensive narrative of the airport drive
Description of the choir's singing rather than leading the congregation in it
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a tragedy and a witness to a testimony, rather than a direct participant in a sacramental event.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the Gospel to the hearer's specific guilt
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Inspiration through example rather than transformation through address.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promise is communal and historical ('They won't be able to kill us off') rather than individual/soteriological.
voorbeelden: God will not be defeated; his people will not be defeated.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdote and shared 'we' in social guilt.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Rhetorical questions regarding gun control and church loyalty.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used for accusation/challenge rather than promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the murder, the King family, the parable, and 'evil'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'theatre' of events that the audience watches.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Recounting the week's events and the biblical parable.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about evil and the nature of the church.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Analysis of social poison) -> Directive (We must ask for forgiveness/Count the doctors).
voorbeelden: We have paraded conspicuous display... God must be asked to forgive us.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The call to repentance is an assertive statement about a need, not a declarative act of grace.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (The Parable) -> Commissive (God will not be defeated).
voorbeelden: He will raise up that Son... God will not be defeated.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Strongly evocative but remains in the third person.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: God has others... [therefore] Christians tell the world, 'They won't be able to kill us off.'
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We have not been serious Christians... Have you? Have I?

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a powerful 'witness' or 'testimony' to resilience. It describes a sacramental reality (the choir singing amidst blood) but describes it as a past-tense event rather than making the sermon itself the event.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Innocent blood on the black-and-white organ keyboard.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God must be asked to forgive us this morning.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Passive voice avoids the performative act of confession or absolution.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a 'report' of a happening rather than a 'happening' in itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The sermon points to the sacrament of the choir's song and the family's faith, but the preacher remains a narrator.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the subject of the parable, but the preacher speaks *about* God's plan.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher speaks as a representative of the grieving community.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly in the endurance of the church.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is left to the 'hills and stars' and the communal spirit.
tekstueel_bewijs: They sang... 'Hold me with thy powerful hand.'

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon acts as a 'memorial' (anamnesis) of the event.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strong in the description of the 'blazing flash' and 'staccato thunder'.
tekstueel_bewijs: I will not call the owner's name, but I know the Man.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense narrative (sat, said, was) and needs a shift to present-tense performatives (I declare, God promises).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God must be asked to forgive us this morning.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Lord, we ask You: forgive us. Or: In the name of Christ, I declare you are forgiven.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a suggestion of a duty to the performance of the act.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is a quote from Martin King Sr. rather than a direct word from God to the listener.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly address the congregation with the promise of the Resurrection.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He lives, you shall live also.
I promise you: the darkness will not overcome your light.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' (general) and 'they' (the Kings), not enough 'you' (the hearer).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Apply the 'They won't kill us off' directly to the hearer's specific fears.
voorbeeldzinnen: Though you are surrounded by poison, God holds your hand.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'Why murder' section is a moral indicative that leads to a social imperative.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the social call in the Declarative of God's victory.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterpiece of narrative homiletics that would be transcendent if it moved from 'talking about' the victory to 'bestowing' the victory.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of grief; SAT focuses on the 'illocutionary' failure to move from description to declaration.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, this is brilliant (pathos/vividness); SAT reveals it is sacramentally 'thin' because it lacks commissives.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the preacher is 'reporting' on God's power rather than 'exercising' the keys of the kingdom.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God must be asked to forgive us.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low; it describes a necessity rather than performing a confession.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: They won't be able to kill us off.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High; it functions as a defiant promise of endurance.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'sacramental' nature of the story itself, assuming the locution carries the performative weight.
